title: How to write this sentence formally, 'Finally, scholarships, financial aids, and fringe benefits were also effective in my application to this program.' - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm not sure I understand but perhaps: Scholarships, financial aid, and fringe benefits were pivotal in my ability to apply to this program. In place of pivotal you could use essential, key, or played a crucial role. I'm not sure what you mean by fringe benefits, you may want to elaborate. Scholarships, financial aid, and fringe benefits effectively aided my application to this program.

This is already plenty formal. The only thing wrong is that it’s in passive voice and it’s too wordy. Without passive voice, you say “Scholarships, financial aids, and fringe benefits were effective in my application to this program.” I can’t tell exactly what you mean by this sentence. Are you applying for “this program?” Or are you telling someone how you were able to “apply yourself to” this program? Meaning “work hard on it?” Because of the financial aid you got? If so, say something like “I could better apply myself to the _____ program because of the help I got from my scholarships, (etc.)”

Unless the word “finally” is imparting an important meaning to your statement, it is unnecessary. If, for example, you are running down all the hoops you had to jump through and all the trouble involved, then, if the financial aid “finally” pulled you through, the use of “finally” would have some bearing on the message. If not, then you should omit it. Note that T-shirt has a hyphen, unless you spell it out as tee shirt or tee shirt. May the force be with you!
There are various ways to rewrite it, but I wouldn’t recommend including it at all. Colleges won’t be impressed at you wanting to apply because you might be able to apply for money.
Yes, this is perfectly correct if you are writing to an American but to a British person or Organisation you should spell “programme” like this
And finally, I could not have progressed this far without the help of scholarships, financial aid and grants, in which all were effective in the application to this program.
